description: G.1 Holly - Reduce to 1m in height as hedge.T.1 & T.2 Cedar - Remove select limbs as illustrated in supporting photos (to open up the much used space below), crown lift to 4m, by removing 2 to 3 branches and smaller sub-laterals & reduce back profile of Cedar by up to 3m.T.3 Horse Chestnut - Lateral reduction to provide 2m clearance from school.T.4 Reduce principal branch of Sycamore adjacent to neighbouring school back to 1m above woodpecker hole due to cordwood damage and necrotic bark developing.T.8 Cedar - Crown lift to 4.5m from ground level.T. Horse Chestnut - Crown lift to 4m from ground level.T.9 Oak - Fell (small Oak crowding & suppressing adjacent Cedar).T.10 Oak - Prune back profile of crown on homeowner's side by 4m, and crown lift to 8m relative to rear patio area. Overhang is excessive and impacting badly on resident.T.11 Oak - Dealt with via DTNT.12 Oak - Reduce unattractive sublateral limb back to strong upward growth 5m higher up the low branch.T.13 Cypress - Fell.T.14 Cork Oak - Gentle formative pruning to encourage central apical dominance.T.15 Oak - Pollard to 4m from ground level.
